Slightly restores target’s HP.
An old-school bandage to be sure.
Did someone drop it here?

A bandage big enough to cover any wound.
Why’d they make one this big?

Greatly restores target HP.
A clean dressing. This could help treat
just about any injury.

Slightly restores HP of those in range.
The container’s a bit old-fashioned, but
there’s enough in here for everyone.

Restores HP of targets in range.
A salve like this should be pretty
effective on all kinds of injuries.

Slightly restores target’s SP.
The meat looks pretty tasty, but somehow
I don’t think we can eat it.

Restores target’s SP.
Just looking at it makes your mouth
water...but it’s inedible.

Greatly restores target SP.
A well-done cut of meat. What kind of
meat IS this, anyway?

Slightly restores SP of those in range.
What a delectable arrangement! But who
arranged it? And for whom...?

Restores SP of targets in range.
This is quite the luxurious spread...

Cures all target’s status abnormalities.
What kind of seed is this? Is it even
edible? I think I’ll pass.

Cures all status abnormalities in area.
A bushel of plump, fruitlike seeds.
I bet they’re full of nutrients.

Cures all stat reductions on the target.
A strange fruit preserved in something.
Do I even wanna know what it is?

Completely restores the target.
Those guys jump for joy when we find
these. Honestly? I don’t see the appeal.

Raises target’s max HP.
Is that a mushroom? Or a crystal? Either
way, I guess their stomachs can take it.

Greatly raises target’s max HP.
The pattern on the mushroom looks like
text... Maybe the professor can read it?

Raises target’s max SP.
The fruit in this world looks so tasty.
Why don’t I ever feel like eating it?

Greatly raises target’s max SP.
The pattern here’s like an circuit. Does
this thing conduct electricity?

Raises target’s PHYS ATK.
Energy’s erupting from the spikes like
a flickering flame.

Greatly raises target’s PHYS ATK.
Would they even feel like eating this?
I mean, it’d power them up, but...

Raises target’s PHYS DEF.
Looks kind of metallic to me. Teeth like
mine couldn’t put a dent in it.

Greatly raises target’s PHYS DEF.
This won’t split open easily, but
I guess you can call that a good thing?

Raises target’s SP ATK.
Seems pretty self-assured. I feel like
I got stronger just looking at it.

Greatly raises target’s SP ATK.
Anything could happen with this carrot.
Logic could go right out the window.

Raises SP DEF of the target.
What’s this, some kind of ore? Bet it
ups defense, if you can even eat it.

Greatly raises SP DEF of the target.
These rocks would shatter your teeth.
Maybe you can swallow it whole?

Raises SPD of the target.
I think there are feet growing out of
it... It isn’t going to run off, is it?

Greatly raises SPD of the target.
How do you even eat this thing? I’d
struggle at the leg parts.

Evolves a Free Monster to Champion.
I don’t think I can read this... Is it
an incantation from this world?

Evolves a Free Monster to Ultimate.
Can residents of this world read this?
I think I’ve seen this shape somewhere.

Evolves a Free Monster to Mega.
The middle of the disc rotates, but why?
Is something written here?

Bonus EXP earned.
Symbols rise up against the clean stone.
Looks like something’s written here...

Max HP+I
Heavier than it looks. Even I could get
some stamina from this thing.

Max SP+I
There’s some sort of device inside. Can
this change abilities?

PHYS ATK+I, SP ATK+I
Looks like sparks. Does this affect
attacking power somehow?

PHYS ATK+II, SP ATK+II, Taunt
I see sparks and eyeballs. Does this
affect attacking or attraction?

PHYS DEF+I, SP DEF+I
The hexagonal pattern looks like
a shield. Maybe this alters defense?

PHYS DEF+II, SP DEF+II, Taunt
Eyeballs in a hexagonal pattern. A
shielding ability that draws others in?

SPD+I, Taunt
Eyes seem to move within the whirlpool.
Maybe to draw in the enemy quickly?

SPD+I
The center looks like a whirlpool.
I sense a storm brewing.

Fire Resistance+II
Flames flare within the shield pattern.
Does this protect against fire?

Water Resistance+II
Is that a water drop in the shield?
Maybe this protects against water.

Earth Resistance+II
A geometric pattern in the shield. Some
kind of mineral?

Wind Resistance+II
Something’s trembling in the hexagon.
A shield to block the air flow?

Light Resistance+II
The shining light pattern is framed.
Like a shield guarding against it.

Dark Resistance+II
A pattern like a black sun... I feel
like I’ll get sucked in looking at it.

Fire Resistance+I, Stun Resistance
A mark of star and flame. They’re
framed. It protects against them?

Water Resistance+I, Freeze Resistance
I see droplets and gems in the frame.
A shield against water and ice, maybe?

Earth Resistance+I, Poison Resistance
I see stone fragments and foam here. Are
they being contained?

Wind Resistance+I, Paralysis Resistance
Thunder and something else is shaking in
here. Does it protect against shock?

Light Resistance+I, Seal Resistance
A light mark and some kind of seal?
Does this protect against those things?

Dark Resistance+I, Confusion Resistance
A dark sun and question mark framed.
The hexagonal mark protects.

All Resistances+I
A hexagonal pattern, marked with a sun.
Does this mean it works on everything?

Stun/Poison/Seal Resistance
Stars, foam and a seal, framed. So
those three things are fenced in?

Freeze/Paralysis/Confusion Resistance
A crystal, lightning and question mark,
framed. Guards against all three?

Nullify Stun
A star hovers over a huge X. Does that
mean the stars won’t work?

Nullify Freeze
A gem—or a crystal, maybe—has been exed
out. That means it prevents hardening?

Nullify Poison
Looks like foam above a cross. Does that
mean it seals poison?

Nullify Paralysis
A thunderbolt hovering above an X. Does
it prevent numbness?

Nullify Seal
A seal for a seal mark. Guess that means
it interferes with interference.

Nullify Confusion
The mark looks like a jack-in-the-box.
Represents a baffling situation?

All Status Abnormality Resistance
Looks like a virus in a box. So it locks
out germs and stuff?

HP recovery every turn, Battle Backup+
This is a heart, not a butt, right?
I feel better just looking at it.

SP recovery every turn, Battle Backup+
The handshake stands for backup.
“Best to act with allies,” is it?

A rusty pair of scissors.
Maybe we can open the door to the gym with these?

An object we found in a classroom.
Could this be used in battle somehow?

An energy drink we found at the dam.
Think it’s safe to drink?

With this, we ought to be able to go through 
the underground waterway.

A picture from a room in the apartment 
complex. Isn’t that Miyuki and Haru...?

A bag of nuts someone dropped.
What could this be used for?

Some fruit we found in the woods.
Should be fine to eat...right?
A tool needed to go to a lower part of the shrine.
A tool needed to go to a lower part of the shrine.

A community center run by the city
that’s also the base for this year’s
camp. It was once an elementary school.

A hallway leading to several rooms.
Though the building was abandoned
decades ago, this hall is well kept.

The cafeteria where we eat our meals.
The food features local ingredients and
is well-regarded. It’s where we relax.

The meeting room for discussions and
presentations. Camp lectures are held
here. I hear it used to be a classroom.

Cherry trees line the path from Camp HQ
to the mountain road. The trees are in
bloom, and a brook babbles beside them.

The path to the shrine and historical
landmark. It sees a lot of use both from
the locals and us campers.

An old tunnel. It looks like it may no
longer be in use.

The entrance to a tunnel far out on the
mountain road. Nobody ever comes here
but the locals, not even us campers.

The inside of an old tunnel. It’s not
part of the route designated by the
camp. Who knows where it may lead?

These woods are dense with undergrowth.
It’s quiet, but the low visibility could
hide any number of dangers.

A shrine out in the woods, damaged in
places and likely abandoned. Surrounded
by red spider lilies, it’s very serene.

The shrine from Takuma’s world.
Something about the surrounding area
seems different.

The entrance to a shrine made of stone.
It has no door, making it easy to go in
or out. It appears ancient.

The inside of the stone shrine. Light
streams in from above, illuminating the
murals on the opposite walls.

A townscape in the current human world.
Buildings stand in rows, and all is
peaceful. It’s a familiar sight.

The current state of the human world.
With chaos on the rise, emergencies have
broken out everywhere. No one’s safe.

A back alley. It’s dark and grimy, the
sort of place most people would avoid.
That makes it the perfect hiding spot.

This is the research lab known as the
Japanese Institute of Electronic
Symbiotes, where we study monsters.

This is a lab inside of JIES. It’s
filled with research equipment developed
using the latest technology.

It’s an abandoned old school building
that looks like Camp HQ. It’s damaged
and overgrown with leaves and vines.

An old school hallway. The walls and
floor have crumbled in places due to
disuse, and it’s overgrown with vines.

A large cafeteria. Plates and silverware
lie scattered about. Students probably
ate here at some point.

An old classroom. Desks and chairs are
strewn around, with blackboards on two
sides. The walls and floor are cracked.

An old music room. Here too are signs of
light damage. A piano, drums, and other
instruments lie abandoned.

An abandoned gym. We could probably use
it for exercise, but we’d need to be
careful of the cracks in the floor.
One of the Four Sovereign Monsters is bound here. It’s a vast chamber made of stone that seems very sturdy.

The woods near the old school. Other
than the school building visible in the
distance, it’s a pretty typical forest.

The forest at night. With only the light
of the moon to go by, visibility is
quite low. Not to be entered lightly.

An odd wooded area where red spider
lilies bloom. The light here is dim, and
the place has an ethereal quality.

This dense forest surrounds the shrine.
Red spider lilies bloom here out of
season, lending it an air of austerity.

A shrine out in the woods, damaged in
places and likely abandoned. Surrounded
by red spider lilies, it’s very serene.

The first floor under the inner shrine.
Murals decorate the walls, as above,
though light doesn’t reach here.

The second floor under the inner shrine.
There are murals here too, and an aura
of silence pervades this level.

The third floor under the inner shrine.
More murals are painted on the walls.
This level is far below the surface.

The inner shrine’s lowest level. The
walls and stones here exude an aura of
wrongness like we’ve never felt before.

The crest of the dam. It has a height of
about 300 ft and spans more than 800 ft
from end to end.

The bottom of the towering dam. Since
we’re downstream, the floodgates are
visible, as is a maintenance facility.
The woods near the underground waterway.

The entrance to the underground waterway
blocked by an iron grate. There’s a path
through here, but it’s locked.

This underground passage connects to the
neighboring island. Oddly, the lights
are on, so things are dim but visible.

The intersection of the main and
auxiliary waterways. An inhospitable
stench of stagnant water fills the air.

An inspection area for the waterway.
It’s big enough to fit heavy machinery,
and a ladder leads to the next island.

The entrance to a shrine made of stone.
It appears ancient, but was apparently
being guarded by something.

One of the Four Sovereign Monsters is
bound here. It’s a vast chamber made of
stone that seems very sturdy.

This path serves as the entrance to the
mountain, an unpaved game trail that
looks out over an iron bridge.

A rail bridge across the river. Damaged
in places, crossing on foot would take
care, and no train is in sight.

The platform for the cable car. Both the
platform and the cable car look aged,
but it’s the only way to the summit.

This forest is on a gentle slope.
Enemies may be lurking inside, but if we
continue, we should reach the summit.

This path leads to the summit. If we
keep following it up the mountain, we’ll
eventually reach the radio tower.

It’s the summit radio tower, surrounded
by a fence. We should be able to get our
bearings from the tower’s top.

A staircase leads up to a maintenance
platform for the radio tower, the
highest vantage point in the area.

It’s the valley floor below the bridge.
The river’s flow is rapid and dangerous.
No man-made facilities are in sight.

It’s an amusement park that seems to
have sprung up out of nowhere. While it
looks fun, it’s also old and run-down.

A castle corridor. With the cracks in
the floor and the broken windows, it
doesn’t seem like it’s being kept up.

One of the castle corridors, lit only by
sunlight. The windows look out on the
Ferris wheel and other attractions.

The throne room in the upper part of the
castle. A throne sits back in the middle
area, old and worn like the corridors.

It’s a jail cell underneath the castle,
directly beneath the throne room pit
trap. Why was this place made?

One of the Four Sovereign Monsters is
bound here. It’s a vast chamber made of
stone that seems very sturdy.

This forest leads to the amusement park,
which is visible in the distance. Broken
equipment lies abandoned within it.

This island is on the other side of the
waterway. Industrial and residential
areas are visible from this beach.

This forest leads to the city. Like all
the other woods here, it has a strange,
otherworldly quality.

A decrepit shopping district. Rusty old
buildings line the streets.

An abandoned group of apartment
complexes. Apparently people once lived
here, but there’s no sign of them now.

The western end of the complex. There
are signs of where children once played
and old cars, but it too is abandoned.

An old apartment where a family once
lived. Now it’s overgrown with grass and
vines, likely due to long neglect.

One of the Four Sovereign Monsters is
bound here. It’s a vast chamber made of
stone that seems very sturdy.

One of the Four Sovereign Monsters is
bound here. It’s a vast chamber made of
stone that seems very sturdy.

This forest is near the factory. Like
all the other woods here, it has a
strange, otherworldly quality.

It’s a giant industrial area, only the
smokestacks emit no smoke and it’s
utterly silent. Nothing is in operation.

It’s a manufacturing site. The machinery
has been set up in a line, but it’s all
worn down and nothing is working.

It’s a section of the factory. Large
machinery has been set up in this vast
workspace. I don’t know what it’s for.

This is the heart of the factory. In its
center is a rotary furnace, which is
somehow the one thing that’s working.

A vast number of books are being stored
here. They seem as worn and damaged as
the building itself.

A library that suddenly appeared in the
forest. Compared to everything else
here, it seems relatively new.

The library reception desk. As with
everywhere else, it seems abandoned, but
it’s notably clean and undamaged.

The library is lined with bookshelves,
holding countless books sorted by genre.
The lights are off, and it’s quiet.

A space unlike anything we’ve ever
experienced, with strange lines like
neural pathways. It’s an odd sight.

An old classroom. Desks and chairs are
strewn around, with blackboards on two
sides. The walls and floor are cracked.

This corridor is on the second floor of
the abandoned school.

An old faculty room. Desks, chairs, and
office supplies are strewn about, and
the walls and floor are cracked.

An old toilet. Apparently the plumbing
is working, but it still doesn’t seem
very hygienic.

The door to the gym. It doesn’t fit well
in its frame and is difficult to open
or close.

A passageway underneath the amusement
park. It’s dark and cool, and the air is
moist.

Rubble lies in the amusement park entry
plaza. Ahead is the main gate, with the
castle and Ferris wheel beyond it.

An interior castle corridor. It runs all
the way around the building.

An interior castle corridor. It runs all
the way around the building.

This path was carved out by someone in
secret, but is surprisingly well-made.

A path out from under the amusement
park. There seem to be several exits.

This space looks like it was meant for
a parade, but the floor and nearby
facilities have fallen into disrepair.

This plaza leads to the castle. It looks
like there were a number of rides here
too, but they’re not running.

This forest leads to the amusement park.
Like all the other woods here, it has
a strange, otherworldly quality.

This forest spreads over the foothills.
Like all the other woods here, it has
a strange, otherworldly quality.

This forest is near the amusement park.
Like all the other woods here, it has
a strange, otherworldly quality.

This forest is near the amusement park.

This forest is near the amusement park.

Like all the other woods here, it has

The entrance to a shrine made of stone.
It has no door, making it easy to go in

A four-way intersection in the
underground waterway. Where the water is

A T-intersection in the underground

A bend in the underground waterway.
Where the water is flowing to or from is

Houses stand here grouped together, but
with no sign of anyone living in them.
They’re just quietly aging ruins.

This street is crowded with shops, but
none are open and no people are to be
found. They’re all old and rusting away.

Like all the other woods here, this one
has a strange, otherworldly quality.

This forest is near the river. Like all
the other woods here, it has a strange,
otherworldly quality.

It’s a giant industrial area. Iron pipes
and rusty fences cover the outer walls.
Out of operation for quite some time.

This building is on the south end of the
factory’s second floor. It’s utterly
silent, with nothing in operation.

Runoff from the dam. This leads to the
underground waterway, but where it goes
from there is unclear.

Here are even more bookshelves, with
countless books grouped by genre. The
lights are off, and it’s quiet.

This forest is near the city. Like all
the other woods here, it has a strange,
otherworldly quality.

This is deep into the forest near the
city. Like all the other woods here, it

These stairs leading further underground
just appeared where there had been solid
floor. I don’t know how it’s possible.
I don’t think I’m done yet.

An unstable space drawing in our heroes,
filled with otherworldly beasts.
Battle here to strengthen your comrades.

Miu’s favorite canned fruit. He used to 
fight with her over cherries when they 
were young, now he gives her whole 
cans of them.

A ring Aoi’s father gave to her. It didn’t 
fit when she was a kid. She’s held 
on to it ever since, looking forward to 
the day it fits.

Minoru’s single, conspicuous sock.
The design shows a hero posing 
pre-transformation. Seems there’s a 
different pose on the other sock.

Shuuji’s simple wallet. His dad gave it
to him on his birthday. Pretty plain, but
you can tell it isn’t cheap, either.

A bus pass holder belonging to Ryo’s dad.
This thing’s a bit worn out. A hand-me-down 
from his dad, his mom treasured it dearly.

A handkerchief lent by a nurse. She borrowed
it once when she felt sick in the hospital. She 
hopes to give it back someday.

A mysterious talisman of the Shinonome 
family. She says her grandpa could see 
things. I don’t get it, but her family’s held 
on to it for generations.

A rock band CD recommended by her dad.
One of her dad’s favorite bands, she’s held 
this dearly since she was young.

PGUC Hero Souls 40th Anniversary: Brave 
Red. First red ranger of the 50-year long 
“Hero Souls” series. Minoru goes nuts over 
the latest season.

An origami old metal from his mom.
Scribbled on the back, it says: “An award for
always working so hard. Love, Mommy.”

A medical record, according to the writing on 
it. Technically I can read it, but it’s all 
technical mumbo-jumbo. Pretty long, all 
things considered.

A charm she got from Kaito. This made her 
feel way better when she was down. Is it 
my imagination or does it read “safe birth”?

As you play the game, you will be presented with
situations where you have some down time.

These are opportunities to check in with your
friends, chat, and increase your Affinities.

You have a limited number of actions in this
mode, so you won’t be able to visit everyone.

Your actions are shown on the upper right. When
the number on the left reaches 0, time’s up.

Use the <sprite index=3> icon to help decide where to go.
Talking to people after moving takes an action.

Also, locations marked with <sprite index=4> take an action
just to move to.

Your Affinities influence Battle Backup actions
in battle and play a large role in evolution,

so it’s important to think about who you want to
get closer to when planning out your actions.
Time to learn some of the basics of battle.

In battle, the order in which units (monsters)
act is determined by their SPD.

The area displayed on the grid represents the
range of your character’s movement.

Defending is an important aspect of battle.

This includes the skill’s Effect, SP Cost,

A skill’s Range is the distance it can reach,

Passive Skills are special abilities that are

Whoa! Looks like you got some help from
a friend!

In battle, your allies will sometimes come to
your aid. This is called Battle Backup.

They can back you up in three different ways:
Team Attack, Encouragement, and Support.

Team Attacks are follow-up attacks on a shared
enemy. You must both be adjacent to this foe.

Encouragement is when you cheer on an ally,
increasing their attack power.

Support is when you cheer on an ally, recovering
a certain amount of their HP or SP.

The likelihood of Battle Backup occurring
depends on both distance and Affinity.

Backup effects can give you an edge in battle!
Try to stick close to your allies.

Your Affinity will change based on choices you
make in the story and can be crucial in battle.

There’s just one enemy left, but its attribute
gives it an advantage, so this could be tough.

Why not get some support from Takuma or the
others for this? It should help a lot.

This will bring up a list of allies in the
fight, so you can choose who to talk to.

You can also see which Rally Effect you’ll get.
Each character provides a different effect.

Sometimes you can talk to enemies, but it looks
like this one isn’t having it. Maybe next time.

Now to cheer on Agumon. Select Agumon from the
list.
Takuma’s words of encouragement have powered up Agumon!

Rally Effects last for a set number of turns, but
each character can cheer only once per battle.

Words of support from a trusted friend can make
a huge difference, turning the tide of battle.

Use them at just the right time and you’ll be
sure to take down even the mightiest foes!

Now that Agumon is all powered up, it’s time to
blow this enemy away!

You can talk to enemies in Free Battle, which is
a good way to gain items, allies, and more.

To do so, you’ll need to navigate a conversation
and improve the monster’s mood.

Conversations with enemies involve choosing
